metadata.title: CVE-2023-32257 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the processing ofSMB2_SESSION_SETUP and SMB2_LOGOFF commands. The issue results from thelack of proper locking when performing operations on an object. An attackercan leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of thekernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32257` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic-64k - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-lowlatency - 5.15.0-94.104
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.15.0-94.104').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.15.0-1050.55').
linux-allwinner-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
